Package com.example.eventapp.repositories

Class SignupRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventapp.repositories.SignupRepository
public class SignupRepository extends Object
The `SignupRepository` class is a singleton repository that provides access to Firestore operations for managing `Signup` data. It supports adding, updating, retrieving, and removing signup records, along with providing LiveData-based methods for observing lists of signups filtered by user ID or event ID. This class enables seamless interaction with Firestore for sign-up data management within the application.

    • addSignup

      public CompletableFuture<String> addSignup(Signup signup)
      Adds a signup document to Firestore.
      Parameters:
      signup - The signup details to be added.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture containing the document ID of the added signup.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if signup, userId, or eventId is null.

      Parameters:

      eventId - The event ID associated with the signup.

      public CompletableFuture<Signup> getSignup(String userId, String eventId)

      Parameters:
      userId - The user ID associated with the signup.
      eventId - The event ID associated with the signup.
      Returns:
